intro: Thesium madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
